Hsuan Lee

I have an BS in Computer Science from National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University, where I was a research assistant in Wireless Internet Research and Engineering Laboratory and an infrastructure engineer in Computer Center.

I participated in two academia-indusrty projects. As a program engineer, I led a team of two to design a multi-kubernetes management platform, decreasing 50% of administrative cost and lowered 80% of time to test switches Software-Defined Network functionalities by a Python testing pipeline respectively.

From Jun 2021 to Sep 2021, I worked at Google, as part of Data Center intern. I primarily maintained systems and network in the biggest Google Data Center in Asia. Additionally, I Automated technicians’ routine by a low cost embedded systems and full-stack application on GCP, reducing 10% of workload.

Email  /  GitHub  /  LinkedIn

Research

I am interested in Kubernetes and Software-Defined Network topics.

A Dynamic on-demand Virtual Customer Premises Equipment Infrastructure


Lee Hsuan
National Science Council, 2022
arxiv / slides /

This research develops a “Dynamic On-demand Infrastructure for Virtualized Client Equipment”, based on ETSI Network Function Virtualization (NFV) architecture, and conforms to BBF TR317 standard of Network Enhanced Residential Gateway (NERG).

A Kebernetes Solution for NAT Traveral


Lee Hsuan
National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University, 2022

Research a new K8s architecture without single-point failure to solve the VXLAN NAT traversal problem.



Work Experience

Besides my work in the Google Data Center.

Data Center Intern


Google Inc.
2021-06-28 ~ 2021-09-24

Maintained systems and network in the biggest Google Data Center in Asia. Managed more than 300,000 servers in the data center with log systems and an automatic pipeline. Automated technicians’ routine with a low-cost embedded system and full-stack application on GCP, reducing 10% of the workload.

Infrastruture Engineer


NYCU CC
2020-02-18 ~ 2022-06-30

Accountable for Linux/BSD workstations, virtual machines, and network equipment that were used by more than 1000 professors and students in the computer science department. Built and maintained the private repository server and reduced security issues. Reduced 35% of the software development life cycle by implementing a CI/CD pipeline.

Part-time Engineer


NEEDLE ROLLER BEARING CO., LTD.
2019-07-01 ~ 2019-08-31

Fulfilled intelligent manufacturing by thin client systems and cloud computing, saving 60% more hardware cost compared to traditional solutions.



Other Projects

These include coursework, side projects and unpublished research work.

Data Structure & Programming


NYCU CS
2020-12-31

Implemented a compiler for a new programming language made by the professor. Using self-made symbol tables, combining a hash table and pointers to reduce 70% of searching time compared to simple linked lists.

Network Services Servers


NYCU CS
2020-06-24

Constructed a cluster offering DNS ,Mail , FTP and Web services. Enhanced the administrative scalability by using LDAP to manage accounts on servers. Use ZFS as a file system, automating backup and enabling recovery. Implemented a reverse proxy server to block suspicious IP.

Design and source code from Jon Barron's website
